data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
Woah thanks everyone!! I was actually a bit scared to post this. I was expecting answer like "juSt gEt goOD" I really love this community

Okay, first of all i have study on and off sense 2020. And im about to take the JLPT N5 this year.

Why am only at N5 you may ask, i have dyslexia so language are really hard for me and im also a perfectionist. If im not getting in the 135 point range on the practice test im not satisficed. Which make me re study the MNN-books And the second is that im using English recourses (which is not my native language)

I have gotten a bunch of お話しドリル which are aiming for 1-2 graders, they are written in "formal Japanese" but every time i open the books up it looks so dauting and i just close the book.

How will i get more courage to read and go to the "next lvl" ?
